text: Alangium havilandii is a tree in the dogwood family Cornaceae. It is named for the British surgeon and naturalist George Darby Haviland. ==Description== Alangium havilandii grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The smooth bark is greyish. The ellipsoid-ovoid fruits ripen pink and measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Alangium havilandii is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is lowland peat swamp forest. ==References== havilandii Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1935 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Alangium havilandii
